meanings.sent1: The prebasal layer of the soil is crucial for plant growth.
meanings.sent2: The scientist studied the prebasal rock formations to understand the Earth's history.
meanings.sent3: The prebasal sunrise painted the sky in beautiful hues.
meanings.sent4: Her prebasal instincts told her to trust her gut feeling.
meanings.sent5: The prebasal aroma of fresh bread filled the kitchen, making everyone hungry.

meanings.definition: Situated or located before the basal part.
meanings.sent1: The prebasal position of the house offered a stunning view of the valley.
meanings.sent2: The prebasal layer of paint protected the wood from moisture.
meanings.sent3: The prebasal seat at the concert had the best acoustics.
meanings.sent4: His prebasal choice of location for the picnic turned out to be perfect.
meanings.sent5: The prebasal shelf in the library held ancient manuscripts.

meanings.definition: Pertaining to or characteristic of the area before the basal part.
meanings.sent1: The prebasal markings on the map indicated the starting point of the trail.
meanings.sent2: The prebasal design of the building incorporated traditional elements.
meanings.sent3: The prebasal decorations in the room added a touch of elegance.
meanings.sent4: Her prebasal knowledge of the subject impressed the professor.
meanings.sent5: The prebasal sound of the distant waterfall soothed her mind.
